title: MsFIN: Multi-scale Feature Interaction Network for Traffic Accident Anticipation
summary: This paper proposes a Multi-scale Feature Interaction Network (MsFIN) for traffic accident anticipation from dashcam perspectives. It addresses challenges in modeling feature-level interactions among traffic participants and capturing complex, asynchronous multi-temporal behavioral cues preceding accidents, which are crucial for proactive safety interventions.
usefulness_reason: The paper focuses on "traffic accident anticipation" and "multi-temporal behavioral cues preceding accidents", which strongly implies spatio-temporal events (point processes in time and space). The use of dashcam data can be considered a contextual dataset. While it doesn't explicitly use the term "Spatio Temporal Point Process", the problem domain is highly relevant.
